metadata.title: CVE-2021-47245 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: synproxy: Fix out of bounds when parsing TCP optionsThe TCP option parser in synproxy (synproxy_parse_options) could readone byte out of bounds. When the length is 1, the execution flow getsinto the loop, reads one byte of the opcode, and if the opcode isneither TCPOPT_EOL nor TCPOPT_NOP, it reads one more byte, which exceedsthe length of 1.This fix is inspired by commit 9609dad263f8 ("ipv4: tcp_input: fix stackout of bounds when parsing TCP options.").v2 changes:Added an early return when length < 0 to avoid callingskb_header_pointer with negative length.
